title: Carnac
extract:
Carnac (Breton: Karnag) is a small town in Morbihan, Brittany. Its main claim to fame are the menhirs surrounding the town.


Understand


Tourism information
1 Tourism Office of Carnac, 74, avenue des Druides, BP 65, ☏ +33 2 97 52 13 52, fax: +33 2 97 52 86 10, accueiltourisme@ot-carnac.fr. Jul–Aug: M–Sa 09:30–19:00, Su 15:00–19:00; Apr–Jun Sep: M–Sa 09:30–12:30 14:00–18:00, Su 15:00–18:00. (updated Feb 2018)


Get in


By Train
Auray train station is 12 km (7.5 mi) away.

1 Gare de Plouharnel-Carnac, rue de la Gare, 56340 Plouharnel (4 km northwest from town center). Served only during summer by TER Bretagne line 32 (Auray–Quiberon), called "le Tire-Bouchon", the "corkscrew". This railway station does not sell tickets.   (updated Feb 2018)


Get around


See
Its standing stones. 
1 Saint-Michel tumulus, chemin du Tumulus (off D781). Archaeological site was constructed between 5000 BC and 3400 BC and classified since 1889.   (updated Feb 2018)
2 Carnac stones (along the D196 road).   (updated Feb 2018)
3 Ménec alignments, route des alignements D196 (between Ménec and Croix-Audran).  (updated Feb 2018)
4 Toulchignan alignment, D119 and route de Kerlescan D196.  (updated Feb 2018)
5 Kermario alignment, route de Kerlescan D196.  (updated Feb 2018)
6 Kerloquet alignment (Manio), route de Kerlescan D196.  (updated Feb 2018)
7 Kerlescan alignments, D196, Kerlescan.  (updated Feb 2018)
8 Petit-Ménec alignments, Chemin de la Métairie (near Kerlescan).  (updated Feb 2018)


Do
Visit one of Carnacs many beaches.


Buy


Eat


Drink


Sleep
Carnac has a couple of campsites and hotels.


Connect
2 La Poste, 18, avenue de la Poste D119, ☏ 36 31. M W–F 09:00–12:00 14:00–17:00, Tu 09:00–12:00 14:30–17:00, Sa 09:00–12:00, closed on Sunday. (updated Feb 2018)
